body_html:
Perhaps you forgot "--enable-shared" when you built Python.
…
On Mon, Mar 13, 2017 at 9:43 PM Peter Cavén ***@***.***> wrote: @soumith <https://github.com/soumith> There are some older libpython3.5m.so* files but I don't use them since moving to 3.6 . I built Python 3.6 from source and installed it to a directory in my home directory. Maybe that's why the .so file doesn't exist? — You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. body_text:
Perhaps you forgot "--enable-shared" when you built Python.
…
On Mon, Mar 13, 2017 at 9:43 PM Peter Cavén ***@***.***> wrote:
 @soumith <https://github.com/soumith> There are some older
 libpython3.5m.so* files but I don't use them since moving to 3.6 .
 I built Python 3.6 from source and installed it to a directory in my home
 directory. Maybe that's why the .so file doesn't exist?

 —

body:
Perhaps you forgot "--enable-shared" when you built Python.


On Mon, Mar 13, 2017 at 9:43 PM Peter Cavén <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @soumith <https://github.com/soumith> There are some older
> libpython3.5m.so* files but I don't use them since moving to 3.6 .
> I built Python 3.6 from source and installed it to a directory in my home
> directory. Maybe that's why the .so file doesn't exist?
>
> —
